frontendDatabase

Class PlayerFrontend

  • java.lang.Object
    • frontendDatabase.PlayerFrontend

  • public class PlayerFrontend
extends java.lang.Object
    The class communicates with player backend class in order to perform tasks for each player

    • Method Detail

      • addNewPlayer

        public static boolean addNewPlayer(javax.swing.JTextField newUsername,
                   javax.swing.JPasswordField newPassword,
                   javax.swing.JTextField securityQuestion,
                   javax.swing.JTextField securityAnswer)
        Handles the creation of a new entry in the database. This initializes all the variables as strings for the createPlayer() method in Backend Database to use as input into the database.
        Parameters:
        newUsername - the username for the new entry
        newPassword - the password for the new entry
        securityQuestion - the security question for the new entry
        securityAnswer - the answer to the security question for the new entry
        Returns:
        returns true if it the entry has been added to the database, false otherwise

      • deleteProfile

        public static boolean deleteProfile(javax.swing.JTextField username)
        The method completely deletes the profile of a user from the database
        Parameters:
        username - the username that needs to be deleted from the database
        Returns:

      • loginOperator

        public static boolean loginOperator(javax.swing.JPasswordField passwordInput,
                    javax.swing.JTextField usernameInput)
        Handles the login operation for a given username and password. The method converts the username and password from JPasswordField and JTextField into Strings for the database to match against.
        Parameters:
        passwordInput - player inputted password
        usernameInput - player inputted username
        Returns:
        return true if the username password combination matches, false otherwise

      • playerExists

        public static boolean playerExists(javax.swing.JTextField usernameInput)
        Handles searching the database for a given username. This method tales a JTextField as input and changes it to a string in order to be searched with.
        Parameters:
        usernameInput - player inputted username
        Returns:
        return true if found, false otherwise

      • checkSecurityAnswer

        public static boolean checkSecurityAnswer(java.lang.String username,
                          javax.swing.JTextField securityAnswer)
        Handles checking the secuirty question in the database for a given username. This method takes a username and a security answer as input and checks if it is identical as the saved one for the specific user.
        Parameters:
        username - - the players username
        securityAnswer - - the player's inputted answer
        Returns:
        return true if the answers are the same, false otherwise

      • getInfo

        public static java.lang.String getInfo(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String databaseField)
        Handles getting a specific info from the database for a specific player.
        Parameters:
        username - - the players username
        databaseField - - Some existing info for a player
        Returns:
        returns the string with the data the field in the database contains

      • changeProfileDetails

        public static boolean changeProfileDetails(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String databaseField,
                           java.lang.String newInfo)
        Handles inputting a specific info to the database for a specific player.
        Parameters:
        username - - the players username
        databaseField - - Some existing info for a player
        newInfo - - the updated info for that specific field in the database
        Returns:
        returns the changes made to the players info
